title: Commemorate the 10th Annual EagleFest celebration to be held on January 15, 2011
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commemorating  the  10th Annual EagleFest cele-
bration to be held on January 15, 2011

WHEREAS, From time to time this Legislative Body takes note  of  certain
extraordinary  organizations  it  wishes  to  recognize for their valued
contributions to the  success  and  progress  of  society  and  publicly
acknowledge their endeavors which have enhanced the basic humanity among
us all; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly  proud  to  commend
the Delaware Valley Eagle Alliance upon the occasion of hosting its 10th
Annual  EagleFest  celebration  on January 15, 2011, in Narrowsburg, New
York; and
  WHEREAS, The Delaware Valley Eagle Alliance and  the  Town  of  Tusten
will host this year's special event; and
  WHEREAS, Under the luminous leadership of Yoke DiGiorgio, the Delaware
Valley  Eagle Alliance is a not-for-profit organization whose mission is
to increase awareness, understanding and promote conservation  of  wild-
life  and  the  natural  environment; its members harbor a dedication to
creating  awareness  through  publications,  educational  programs   and
events; and
  WHEREAS,  Wildlife and environmental conservation and preservation are
challenges that touch all of us; the EagleFest was  established  by  the
Alliance  in an effort to foster awareness toward conservation and vital
natural resources; and
  WHEREAS, The festival is built on the belief that the preservation and
stewardship of the natural world is essential to the  continued  growth,
development and prosperity of all life that exists on Earth; and
  WHEREAS, EagleFest is a one-day event held each year in January in the
Town  of  Narrowsburg;  the event is enhanced annually with new speakers
and presentations to provide all who attend an opportunity  to  see  and
experience new and interesting programs; and
  WHEREAS,  EagleFest  combines  entertainment  and  education  for  all
attendees, brings local residents and out-of-town visitors of  all  ages
to  the  day's  multi-faceted  series  of  activities;  it  directs much
deserved attention to the natural resources that  enrich  lives  in  the
Delaware River Valley region; and
  WHEREAS,  This  eventful  program  includes multiple live bird of prey
demonstrations, and  lectures  by  biologists  and  conservationists  on
important current wildlife and conservational issues; and
  WHEREAS, Included in this auspicious event are wildlife films, photog-
raphy  exhibits, eagle viewing, a nature and wildlife art show, a silent
auction of wildlife art by  regional  artists  and  numerous  children's
programs; and
  WHEREAS,  It is the sense of this Legislative Body that the continuing
welfare of the citizens of the State of New York is greatly enriched and
reliably served by the purposeful endeavors of  organizations  that  are
committed  to  the  preservation  of  our  natural  environment  and the
enhancement of the appreciation  of  the  distinctive  features  of  our
surroundings,  and to the economic well-being of the areas in which they
exist; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED, That this Legislative Body pause  in  its  deliberations  to
commemorate  the 10th Annual EagleFest celebration to be held on January
15, 2011; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Yoke DiGiorgio, Director,  Delaware  Valley  Eagle  Alliance,
Narrowsburg, New York,
